bug.summary: Incoherence between RandomTransform.parse_range and RandomGhosting intensity
bug.description: üêõBug When given a single positive number x, RandomTransform.parse_range outputs the tuple (-x, x). From the doc of RandomGhosting, it states that you can give a single value for the intensity parameter. However, if you do so you get an error as intensity cannot be negative. To reproduce import torchio tranform = torchio.transforms.RandomGhosting(intensity=1) Traceback (most recent call last): File "/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/IPython/core/interactiveshell.py", line 3326, in run_code exec(code_obj, self.user_global_ns, self.user_ns) File "<ipython-input-3-57113dda3e8e>", line 2, in <module> tranform = torchio.transforms.RandomGhosting(num_ghosts=10, intensity=1) File ".../torchio/torchio/transforms/augmentation/intensity/random_ghosting.py", line 63, in __init__ raise ValueError(message) ValueError: Intensity must be a positive number, not -1 Expected behavior I guess the expected behavior would be to get the range [x, x] when providing the single value x. TorchIO version 0.17.7
